sen.j: 尼子 勝久（あまご かつひさ）は戦国時代 (日本)の武将。
sen.e: Katsuhisa AMAGO was a Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
Katsuhisa AMAGO was a Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).
sen.cmt: カッコ内のスペース消去しました。
sen.e: Katsuhisa AMAGO was a Japanese military commander in the Sengoku period (period of warring states).

sen.j: 尼子経久の次男尼子国久の孫で、尼子誠久の五男。
sen.e: He was a grandson of Kunihisa AMAGO, who was the second son of Tsunehisa AMAGO, and the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO.
He was a grandson of Kunihisa AMAGO, who was the second son of Tsunehisa AMAGO, and the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO.
He was a grandson of Kunihisa AMAGO, who was the second son of Tsunehisa AMAGO, and the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO.

sen.j: 天文22年（1553年）、尼子誠久の五男として生まれる。
sen.e: He was born as the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO in 1553.
He was born as the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO in 1553.
He was born as the fifth son of Sanehisa AMAGO in 1553.

sen.j: 天文23年（1554年）、祖父の尼子国久、父の誠久ら新宮党が尼子晴久によって誅殺されたとき、小川重遠によって助けられる。
sen.e: His life was saved by Shigetoo OGAWA when Haruhisa AMAGO killed members of Shingu-to, including his grandfather, Kunihisa AMAGO and his father, Sanehisa for a purge in 1554.
His life was saved by Shigeto OGAWA when Haruhisa AMAGO killed members of Shingu-to, including his grandfather, Kunihisa AMAGO and his father, Sanehisa for a purge in 1554.
His life was saved by Shigeto OGAWA when Haruhisa AMAGO killed members of Shingu-to, including his grandfather, Kunihisa AMAGO and his father, Sanehisa for a purge in 1554.

sen.j: 後に晴久が保証人となり、京都に出て東福寺の僧侶となった。
sen.e: Later, he went to Kyoto to become a priest of Tofukuji-Temple with a guarantee by Haruhisa.
Later, he went to Kyoto to become a priest of Tofukuji-Temple with a guarantee by Haruhisa.
Later, he went to Kyoto to become a priest of Tofukuji-Temple with a guarantee by Haruhisa.

sen.j: 永禄9年（1566年）、毛利元就の侵攻を受けて、尼子氏は滅亡した。
sen.e: The Amago clan was extinguished by Motonari MORI's invasion in 1566.
The Amago clan was extinguished by Motonari MORI's invasion in 1566.
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: The Amago clan was extinguished by Motonari MORI's invasion in 1566.

sen.j: しかし永禄11年（1568年）、尼子家の再興を図る山中鹿介・立原久綱らに擁立されて還俗し、隠岐国で機会を窺うこととなる。
sen.e: However, Katsuhisa AMAGO was backed up by Shikanosuke YAMANAKA, Hisatsuna TACHIHARA and others, who attempted the Amago clan's revival, to return to secular life and watched his opportunity in Oki Province.

However, in 1568 Katsuhisa AMAGO was backed up by Shikanosuke YAMANAKA, Hisatsuna TACHIHARA and others, who attempted the Amago clan's revival, to return to secular life and watched his opportunity in Oki Province.
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正、「永禄11年（1568年）」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。
sen.e: However, in 1568 Katsuhisa AMAGO was backed up by Shikanosuke YAMANAKA, Hisatsuna TACHIHARA and others, who attempted the Amago clan's revival, to return to secular life and watched his opportunity in Oki Province.

sen.j: 永禄12年（1569年）に隠岐から出雲国に入ると、尼子氏の旧臣の支援を得て出雲新山城に入る。
sen.e: He went to Izumo Province from Oki Province to enter Shinyama-jo Castle in Izumo with support of old vassals of the Amago clan in 1569.
He went to Izumo Province from Oki Province to enter Shinyama-jo Castle in Izumo with support of old vassals of the Amago clan in 1569.
He went to Izumo Province from Oki Province to enter Shinyama-jo Castle in Izumo with support of old vassals of the Amago clan in 1569.

sen.j: そして月山富田城奪還を目論むが、毛利元秋や天野隆重の奮戦により攻略できなかった。
sen.e: Then he attempted to recapture Gassantoda-jo Castle but failed because of hard resistance from Motoaki MORI and Takashige AMANO.
Then he attempted to recapture Gassantoda-jo Castle but failed because of hard resistance from Motoaki MORI and Takashige AMANO.
Then he attempted to recapture Gassantoda-jo Castle but failed because of hard resistance from Motoaki MORI and Takashige AMANO.

sen.j: 永禄13年（1570年）2月、布部山の戦いで毛利軍と戦って敗北を喫し、京都へと逃れた。
sen.e: In February, 1570, he fought against the Mori forces in the Battle of Fubeyama, but was defeated and escaped to Kyoto.
In March, 1570, he fought against the Mori forces in the Battle of Fubeyama, but was defeated and escaped to Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 旧暦→新暦に修正しました。
sen.e: In March, 1570, he fought against the Mori forces in the Battle of Fubeyama, but was defeated and escaped to Kyoto.

sen.j: 天正2年（1574年）、因幡国の戦国大名・山名豊国の支援を得て因幡国からの出雲国侵攻を企てるも失敗に終わる。
sen.e: In 1574, he attempted to invade Izumo Province via Inaba Province with the support of a Japanese feudal lord in Inaba Province, Toyokuni YAMANA, but the invasion ended in failure.
In 1574, he attempted to invade Izumo Province via Inaba Province with the support of a Japanese feudal lord in Inaba Province, Toyokuni YAMANA, but the invasion ended in failure.
In 1574, he attempted to invade Izumo Province via Inaba Province with the support of a Japanese feudal lord in Inaba Province, Toyokuni YAMANA, but the invasion ended in failure.

sen.j: その後は織田信長の傘下に入り、豊臣秀吉の中国方面軍に付けられた。
sen.e: Later, he came under the umbrella of Nobunaga ODA and was allotted to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's forces for attacking Chugoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, he came under the umbrella of Nobunaga ODA and was allotted to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's forces for attacking Chugoku.
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: Later, he came under the umbrella of Nobunaga ODA and was allotted to Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's forces for attacking Chugoku.

sen.j: 天正5年（1577年）には宇喜多直家の支城である播磨国上月城を攻略し、その守備を命じられた。
sen.e: In 1577, he captured Kozuki-jo Castle in Harima Province, which was a branch castle of Naoie UKITA, and was then ordered to defend the castle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1577, he captured Kozuki-jo Castle in Harima Province, which was a branch castle of Naoie UKITA, and was then ordered to defend the castle.
In 1577, he captured Kozuki-jo Castle in Harima Province, which was a branch castle of Naoie UKITA, and was then ordered to defend the castle.

sen.j: 天正6年（1578年）、尼子勝久・山中幸盛打倒の執念に燃える毛利氏は、宇喜多直家率いる宇喜多軍と上月城に迫った。
sen.e: In 1578, the Mori clan, who was vengeful to defeat Katsuhisa AMAGO and Yukimori YAMANAKA, and Ukita's forces led by Naoie UKITA approached Kozuki-jo Castle.
In 1578, the Mori clan, who was vengeful to defeat Katsuhisa AMAGO and Yukimori YAMANAKA, and Ukita's forces led by Naoie UKITA approached Kozuki-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正しました。
sen.e: In 1578, the Mori clan, who was vengeful to defeat Katsuhisa AMAGO and Yukimori YAMANAKA, and Ukita's forces led by Naoie UKITA approached Kozuki-jo Castle.

sen.j: その総勢は3万人である。
sen.e: The forces had thirty thousand in all.
The forces had thirty thousand in all.
The forces had thirty thousand in all.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉は織田信長の命により、別所長治が籠る三木城攻略に専念することとなり（三木合戦）、尼子主従に上月城からの撤退を要請した。
sen.e: Following Nobunaga ODA's order, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI concentrated an attack against Miki-jo Castle where Nagaharu BESSHO was besieged (the Battle of Miki), so Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI requested Katsuhisa AMAGO and his vassals to withdraw from Kozuki-jo Castle.

Following Nobunaga ODA's order, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI concentrated on an attack against Miki-jo Castle where Nagaharu BESSHO was besieged (the Battle of Miki), so Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI requested Katsuhisa AMAGO and his vassals to withdraw from Kozuki-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: concentrated→concentrated onに修正、全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正、カッコ内のスペース消去しました。
sen.e: Following Nobunaga ODA's order, Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI concentrated on an attack against Miki-jo Castle where Nagaharu BESSHO was besieged (the Battle of Miki), so Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI requested Katsuhisa AMAGO and his vassals to withdraw from Kozuki-jo Castle.

sen.j: しかし尼子主従はこれに従わず籠城し、毛利氏の猛攻に遭い、ついには降伏することとなった（上月城の戦い）。
sen.e: However, they didn't accept the request and held the castle, then ended up surrendering because of a violent attack of the Mori's forces (the Battle of Kozuki-jo Castle).
However, they did not accept the request and held the castle, then ended up surrendering because of a violent attack of the Mori's forces (the Battle of Kozuki-jo Castle).
sen.cmt: didn’t→did notとし、全角アポストロフィーを半角に修正、カッコ内のスペース消去しました。
sen.e: However, they did not accept the request and held the castle, then ended up surrendering because of a violent attack of the Mori's forces (the Battle of Kozuki-jo Castle).

sen.j: 尼子勝久は嫡男・豊若丸や弟の尼子通久、重臣の神西元通らと共に自害した。
sen.e: Katsuhisa AMAGO killed himself together with his legitimate son, Toyowakamaru; his brother, Michihisa AMAGO; the head of his vassals, Motomichi JINZAI; and others.
Katsuhisa AMAGO killed himself together with his legitimate son, Toyowakamaru; his younger brother, Michihisa AMAGO; the head of his vassals, Motomichi JINZAI; and others.
Katsuhisa AMAGO killed himself together with his legitimate son, Toyowakamaru; his younger brother, Michihisa AMAGO; the head of his vassals, Motomichi JINZAI; and others.

sen.j: 享年26。
sen.e: He was 26 years old.
He was 26 years old.
He was 26 years old.

sen.j: また、山中幸盛は捕虜となり移送される途中に斬殺された。
sen.e: Yukimori YAMANAKA was taken prisoner and was later killed with a sword while being transferred.
Yukimori YAMANAKA was taken prisoner and was later killed with a sword while being transferred.
Yukimori YAMANAKA was taken prisoner and was later killed with a sword while being transferred.

sen.j: これにより大名としての尼子氏再興運動は潰えることとなる。
sen.e: This collapsed the movement for revival of the AMAGO clan as a Japanese feudal lord.
This collapsed the movement for revival of the Amago clan as a Japanese feudal lord.
sen.cmt: the AMAGO clan→the Amago clanに修正しました。
sen.e: This collapsed the movement for revival of the Amago clan as a Japanese feudal lord.

tit.cmt: 統一リストの表記に変更しました。

sen.j: 陰徳太平記によると、毛利家に降伏したとき、山中幸盛ら捕虜となった家臣たちに対して次の様に述べたとされる。
sen.e: According to "Intoku-taiheiki" (old chronicle), Katsuhisa AMAGO said to his vassals including Yukimori YAMANAKA, who were taken prisoner, when he surrendered to the Mori forces.
According to the Intoku-taiheiki (old chronicle), Katsuhisa AMAGO said to his vassals including Yukimori YAMANAKA, who were taken prisoner, when he surrendered to the Mori forces.
sen.cmt: 原文表記に合わせ、"Intoku-taiheiki"→the Intoku-taiheikiとし、カッコ内のスペース消去しました。
sen.e: According to the Intoku-taiheiki (old chronicle), Katsuhisa AMAGO said to his vassals including Yukimori YAMANAKA, who were taken prisoner, when he surrendered to the Mori forces.

sen.j: 「法衣をまとって一生を送るべきはずであった自分を一度は尼子の大将にしてくれたことを感謝する。」
sen.e: I appreciate that you made me a head of AMAGO once, otherwise I would have spent my whole life being wrapped in a clerical garment."
I appreciate that you made me a head of Amago once, otherwise I would have spent my whole life being wrapped in a clerical garment.'
sen.cmt: AMAGO→Amagoとし、クォーテーション修正しました。
sen.e: I appreciate that you made me a head of Amago once, otherwise I would have spent my whole life being wrapped in a clerical garment.'

sen.j: 「今後は命を永らえ、命を大切にするように。」
sen.e: "From now on, live long lives and value your lives."
From now on, live long lives and value your lives.'
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正しました。
sen.e: From now on, live long lives and value your lives.'

sen.j: このように、家臣想いの一面があったが、戦国武将にはあまり向いていない人物だったようである。
sen.e: Thus, he had an aspect of being considerate to his vassals, but seems to have not been suitable as a military commander.
Thus, he had an aspect of being considerate to his vassals, but it seems he was not suitable as a military commander in the Sengoku period.
sen.cmt: seems to have not been suitable→it seems he was not suitableとし、in the Sengoku periodを追加しました。
sen.e: Thus, he had an aspect of being considerate to his vassals, but it seems he was not suitable as a military commander in the Sengoku period.
